sentence.Network_en: The court has no jurisdiction over foreign diplomats living in this country.
sentence.Network_cn: 法院对驻本国的外交官无裁判权.

sentence.Network_en: It hardly falls within the area under the police station's jurisdiction.
sentence.Network_cn: 它几乎不在该派出所的辖区之内.

sentence.Network_en: It doesn't lie within my jurisdiction to set you free.

list.abs: 领土管辖权基于领土管辖权（territorial jurisdiction）,一国于其领土范围内,有独占且完整的管辖权,不受他国之干涉。-

普遍管辖权（Universal Jurisdiction）是国际法的原则之一。于二次大战后，除了国际法庭追诉重大违反人权罪行的机制外，国际社会 …
[原创]领事裁判权领事裁判权(Consular Jurisdiction)是一种治外法权,指一国通过其驻外领事,对于在别国领土内的本国臣民,按照本国法律行使司法管辖权。源于12世纪.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French jurediction, from Latin jurisdictio(n-), from jus, jur- 'law' + dictio 'saying' (from dicere 'say')

entry.def: Jurisdiction is the power that a court of law or an official has to carry out legal judgments or to enforce laws.

example.ex: The British police have no jurisdiction over foreign bank accounts.
example.tran: 外国银行账户不在英国警方的管辖权限之内。

entry.def: A jurisdiction is a state or other area in which a particular court and system of laws has authority.

means.word_mean: 1. (law) the right and power to interpret and apply the law;
2. in law; the territory within which power can be exercised

auth_sentence.content: Now, suddenly, I was under their jurisdiction again.
auth_sentence.res_content: Now, suddenly, I was under their jurisdiction again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Now, suddenly, I was under their jurisdiction again.

auth_sentence.content: The Cabinet had no jurisdiction over military matters.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Cabinet had no jurisdiction over military matters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Cabinet had no jurisdiction over military matters.
